title: Israel's complex battle of the tunnels
summary: The Israeli army showed a tunnel built by Hamas to the international press. The Islamist organization has been preparing for an underground war for years.

title: With Azerbaijan irritated by France's support to Armenia, tensions rise
summary: Two diplomats from the French embassy in Azerbaijan were expelled on Tuesday, and France replied tit-for-tat the following day. Baku has also offered its support to movements demanding independence from France.

title: The dual legacy of Jacques Delors
summary: The course charted by the former president of the European Commission remains relevant today, as the deceptive winds of narrow nationalism prepare to sweep through the European elections in June 2024.

title: Taiwan questions the role of Chinese literature and history in education
summary: Ahead of the January 13 elections, a reform reducing the place of Chinese history in textbooks illustrates the government's desire to assert Taiwanese identity.

title: Venezuela to conduct military drills in response to British warship arriving near Guyana
summary: The United Kingdom on Sunday said it would dispatch a military patrol vessel to support Guyana, a former British colony currently embroiled in a crisis over the oil-rich Essequibo territory claimed by Venezuela.

title: In Moscow, the 'Almost Naked' party sets Russia abuzz
summary: The courts have already equated this 'dress code' with 'LGBT propaganda.' The glitz and glamour of the evening aroused anger in a country at war.

title: Iran's accelerated uranium enrichment condemned by Western powers
summary: The International Atomic Energy Agency reported that Iran has recently stepped up its enriched uranium production, despite consistently denying any aspirations to develop nuclear weapons capabilities.

title: Argentina's main union calls for general strike against Milei's reforms
summary: Libertarian President Javier Milei has put forward a decree and a set of bills aiming to amend or eliminate over 350 economic regulations and enable the privatization of over 40 public companies.

title: In Ukraine, General Zaluzhnyi puts pressure on President Zelensky
summary: The Ukrainian commander-in-chief and the president passed the buck back and forth on the thorny issue of mobilization. The former gave a press conference in Kyiv on Tuesday, after the latter's annual speech.

title: Two Russians imprisoned for poetry against Ukraine war
summary: Artyom Kamardin, who said he was raped in detention, was sentenced to seven years in prison, and Yegor Shtovba to five-and-a-half years.

title: The real threat (and uncertain success) of Trumpism
summary: Analyses and polls may predict Donald Trump's victory in the November 2024 US presidential election, but the more the businessman's ideas veer to the extremes, the more Republicans are punished at the ballot box.

title: Macron asks Netanyahu for 'lasting ceasefire' in Gaza
summary: During a call with the Israeli prime minister, the French president spoke of his 'deepest concern' about civilian deaths and the humanitarian emergency in Gaza

title: Romania and Bulgaria to partially join Schengen area of free movement
summary: The two countries found a deal with Austria, which had previously vetoed their entry, to join the European Schengen area of free movement by sea and air.

title: UK lifts Brexit obstacles for French students and schoolchildren
summary: French and EU nationals at schools in France who cross the Channel for a language-learning holiday will now need to carry only a simple identity.

title: 'I say I am homosexual because that is what it is': Queer experiences tackled for the first time on French TV in 1975
summary: 'The underground years' (3/5). On January 21, 1975, 19 million viewers watched the first French TV debate on LGBTQ+ issues. 'Les Dossiers de l'écran' invited authors, doctors, a priest and, against them, an MP who was convinced that queerness was an 'illness.'

title: Russia reopens embassy in Burkina Faso closed in 1992
summary: After nearly 32 years without a diplomatic presence in the West African nation, Russia announced that it was reopening its embassy in Ouagadougou, following an October deal to construct a nuclear power plant in Burkina Faso.

title: Public toilets in Japan are 'sanctuaries of peace and hygiene'
summary: Public restrooms in Japanese cities are a surprise to first-time visitors: Numerous and enviably clean, they stand in stark contrast to their Europe counterparts.

title: Climate: French greenhouse gas emissions fell in the first three quarters of 2023
summary: According to the Interprofessional Technical Center for the Study of Atmospheric Pollution, the three main contributors to this drop estimated at 4.6% compared to 2022, are energy production, industry, and buildings.

title: Trump disqualified from presidential primary in Maine
summary: Maine's Democratic secretary of state on Thursday removed former President Donald Trump from the state's presidential primary ballot, citing the US Constitution's insurrection clause.
